paper_abstract: The alternating group graph, denoted by AG(n), is one of the popular interconnection networks, which has many attractive properties. In this paper, we prove that for any two distinct nodes mu, and nu, there exist m node-disjoint paths for any integer n >= 3 with 1 <= m <= 2n - 4 whose union covers all the nodes of AG(n). For any node of AG(n) has exactly 2n-4 neighbors, 2n-4 is the maximum number of node-disjoint paths can be constructed in AGn. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: One-to-one disjoint path covers on alternating group graphs
